name: Version 1.21
Version 1.20
Version 1.19
body:
![ic_launcher](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3448386/70924065-d69ee000-2020-11ea-9f24-980c36efc6b0.png)
* Updated build scripts and sonivox sources
* Restored missing functions

Google have removed the functions for streaming midi code to the synthesiser. I have restored them in an addition file (`eas_midi.c`).

name: Version 1.15
Version 1.14
body:
![ic_launcher](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3448386/27029626-0149c6e6-4f61-11e7-8a77-42bc35f0ad52.png)
*  The sonivox library is now built as a static library and linked with the midi library. This should resolve problems with various android versions.

name: Version 1.13
body:
* Revert native library name to libsonivox.so, so some older devices can use the built in version
* 32 bit native libraries only, so some devices can't use the broken 64 bit version
* Add setVolume() by @amitayd 

Note:
Devices running 4.2.2 (API 17) and below don't appear to be able to load a second native library unless it's built in. Devices running 7.0 (API 24) and above don't allow the use of unsupported built in native libraries. Devices running 64 bit 5.01 or 5.1.1 may have a broken 64 bit version of the sonivox native library and may use the broken built in version rather then the fixed version in the driver.

name: Version 1.12
body:
* Changed name of sonivox library so devices can't use the broken built in version
* 32 bit version added

name: Version 1.11
body:
- Converted to gradle
- App now in MidiTest
- 32 bit version added
- Get from [JitPack](https://jitpack.io/#billthefarmer/mididriver)

name: Version 1.10
body: - Includes ARM assembler source files

name: Version 1.09
body:
- Includes 64 bit native libraries
- Works correctly on 64 bit devices - Google have fixed the 64 bit reverb bug

name: Version 1.08
body:
- Rebuild libsonivox.so without spurious dependencies on libutils and libcutils
- The ARM versions have been built without the assembler source files

name: Version 1.07
body: - Add libsonivox.so files - Android 7 does not allow the use of libraries not supported in the NDK.

name: Version 1.06
body:
- Add midi constants from jhindin branch
- Added aar libraries for gradle builds

name: Version 1.05
body:
- Uses native OpenSLES library
- Added EAS config to app

name: Version 1.04
body: -  Removed 64 bit libraries as emulator and devices appear to have been built with a broken 64 bit version of libsonivox.so

name: Version 1.03
body:
- Dynamic linking of sonivox library
- Listener callback on UI thread

name: Version 1.02
body:
- Add custom rules to move source file for library build
- Change notes to chords, relabel buttons

name: Version 1.01
body:
- Updated JNI build to use prebuilt shared libraries
- Added custom rules to remove prebuilt shared libraries

name: Version 1.0
body: -  Convert jni code to C++
